decision_conditions:
Reason : 1 - The development, the subject of this application, by reason of design, size, siting and appearance is considered an unneighbourly form of development which is visually intrusive, overly dominant and harmful to the privacy and visual amenity of neighbours and are unsympathetic to the design, materials, scale, form and proportions of the original house and character of the local area contrary to the principles of policies D3 of the London Plan 2021, DM D2, and DM D3 of the Adopted Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014 and CS 14 of the Merton Core Strategy 2011
 
Reason : 2 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
"	The application was not considered to comply with the provisions of the Development Plan and NPPF as submitted, and would have required substantial changes such that a new application would be required. 
"	The applicant/agent was informed of any issues arising during consideration of the application and the need for further detail and clarification but no information was not forthcoming. 
"	It is noted that the applicant/agent did not engage in any pre-application discussions.
"	The applicant is advised to seek pre-application advice on any resubmission.
description: ERECTION OF BRICK BOUNDARY WALLS TO REAR GARDEN AND TIMBER DECKING
